intro: Cupania geminata, commonly known as the twinleaf cupania, is a species of flowering plant in the Euphorbiaceae family. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas, including parts of Central and South America. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that often appear in pairs, giving it its common name. It produces small, greenish flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Cupania geminata is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
